page.title: 18DONCASTER THEN AND NOW
page.content: WE INTERVIEWED AS MANY LOCAL PEOPLE AS POSSIBLE WHO WERE OF A SUITABLE AGE AND ASKED HOW THINGS HAD CHANGED SINCE THE SECOND WORLD WAR.MANY REMEMBERED WHEN THE BOMBS WERE DROPPING AND WHEN ENEMY PLANES WERE FLYING OVER.ONE PERSON TOLD US HOW THE PLANT WORKS CAUGHT FIRE. MOST PEOPLE USED TO SPEND THEIR TIME DOING KNITTING AND SEWING AND IN THIS RESPECT THINGS ARE MUCH THE SAME NOW. EVERYBODY HAD RATION BOOKS AND CLOTHING COUPONS.WHEN THEY RAN OUT PEOPLE WOULD WAIT FOR NEW ONES OR BUY THEM FROM OTHER PEOPLE. MOST PEOPLE WE INTERVIEWED HAVE LIVED IN DONCASTER FOR MANY YEARS.THE HOUSING CONDITIONS ARE NOW MUCH BETTER AND MORE CONVENIENT.THEY NOW HAVE CENTRAL HEATING,GAS FIRES,WASHING MACHINES,REFRIGERATORS,TELEPHONES, TELEVISIONS,VIDEOS AND COMPUTERS.
